title: Soba Noodles With Roasted Brussels Sprouts And Walnut-miso Sauce
summary: Soba Noodles With Roasted Brussels Sprouts And Walnut-miso Sauce might be just the main course you are searching for. This recipe serves 2. One serving contains 959 calories, 31g of protein, and 49g of fat. For $4.37 per serving, this recipe covers 42% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. If you have garlic, mellow miso paste, salt, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the chard you could follow this main course with the Apple Orchard Dessert as a dessert. It will be a hit at your Christmas event. A few people made this recipe, and 12 would say it hit the spot. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 38 minutes. It is a good option if you're following a dairy free and vegetarian diet. With a spoonacular score of 96%, this dish is amazing. Similar recipes include Soba Noodles with Roasted Brussels Sprouts and Walnut Miso Sauce, Shaved Brussels Sprouts and Soba Noodles with Ginger-Honey Sauce, and Miso Roasted Brussels Sprouts.

winePairing.pairingText: No one wine will suit every pasta dish. Pasta in a tomato-based sauce will usually work well with a medium-bodied red, such as a montepulciano or chianti. Pasta with seafood or pesto will fare better with a light-bodied white, such as a pinot grigio. Cheese-heavy pasta can pair well with red or white - you might try a sangiovese wine for hard cheeses and a chardonnay for soft cheeses. We may be able to make a better recommendation if you ask again with a specific pasta dish.
